snippet: Researchers found some signs of long-term decline in the dinosaurs’ last 12 million years, but nothing that might dislodge the asteroid’s role in the mass extinction.
abstract: Stephen L Brusatte study published online in journal Nature Communications paints a nuanced portrait of dinosaurs during the last 12 million years of their existence; findings, however, do not ultimately dispel the common belief that an asteroid was the major factor in a catastrophic mass extinction at the end of the Cretaceous period.
lead_paragraph: Researchers found some signs of long-term decline in the dinosaurs’ last 12 million years, but nothing that might dislodge the asteroid’s role in the mass extinction.

headline.seo: Asteroid’s Impact Still Central to Dinosaurs’ Extinction
headline.main: Huge Asteroid Is Still the Central Villain in Dinosaurs’ Extinction
headline.print_headline: Huge Asteroid Is Still the Central Villain in Dinosaurs’ Extinction
